verses.roman:
yājñavalkyaś ca tac-chiṣya
āhāho bhagavan kiyat
caritenālpa-sārāṇāṁ
cariṣye 'haṁ su-duścaram

synonyms: yājñavalkyaḥ—Yājñavalkya; ca—and; tat-śiṣyaḥ—the disciple of Vaiśampāyana; āha—said; aho—just see; bhagavan—O master; kiyat—how much value; caritena—with the endeavor; alpa-sārāṇām—of these weak fellows; cariṣye—shall execute; aham—I; su-duścaram—that which is very difficult to perform.
translation: Once Yājñavalkya, one of the disciples of Vaiśampāyana, said: O master, how much benefit will be derived from the feeble endeavors of these weak disciples of yours? I will personally perform some outstanding penance.
